title: Sri Lanka hosts London investor forum aiming foreign money into capital market
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Colombo Stock Exchange  (CSE) in association with the Securities and Exchange Commission and nine stock brokering firms will host an investor forum in London from March 28-30 to boost foreign investments into the island nation’s capital market.
“The main focus is to attract foreign investments from Sri Lankan diaspora and foreign funds,” a CSE source told EconomyNext.

Sri Lanka suffered 50 billion rupees worth foreign outflow last year due to the macroeconomic uncertainty, sovereign debt default and exchange rate risks. It has seen 2.7 billion rupees of outflow so far this year, the CSE data showed.

The latest forum in the CSE’s investment roadshow comes as Sri Lanka is struggling with economic crisis after nearly 32 percent rupee depreciation amid severe forex shortage, lack of essential commodities, rise in interest rates, record high inflation, negative returns on fixed income, and extended power cuts.
